El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una vaca lechera para la producción de leche. De esta manera, podrá generar más ganancias ya que procesara la leche, obteniendo lácteos que forman parte de su dieta familiar. Y con los ingresos poder comprar más vacas y brindar a sus hijos lo que necesitan para desarrollarse.
texts.en: Blanca is 43 years old and a single mother with a girl and a boy. She has worked for 14 years raising cows, which she learned from her family. She is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy a dairy cow for producing milk. This will allow her to make more profits, because she will process the milk and make dairy products that are part of her family’s diet. With the income she earns, she will be able to buy more cows and provide her children with the necessities for growing up.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for producing milk.

loans.name: Favio Evelio

texts.es: El Sr. Favio tiene 34años,  casado con tres  hijos que son de las edades de 9,6  y 3 años, el se dedica a la compra y venta de accesorios y repuestos para movilidades desde hace ya bastante tiempo tiene su puesto de venta de accesorios que se encuentra en la zona de la 16 de Julio en este lugar es muy concurrido por choferes que realizan el mantenimiento de sus vehículos, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr.  Favio va a usar este préstamo para la compra de accesorios y repuestos para surtir su puesto   y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, El Sr.  Favio va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando accesorios y repuestos al por mayor,   El Sr.  Favio es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Favio is 34 years old, married, and has three children who are nine, six, and three years old.  He has been buying and selling vehicle parts and accessories for a while now.  He has a stall where he sells accessories that is in the 16 de Julio area, which is where a lot of drivers go to have their vehicles serviced.  This loan will be his first cycle with the institution.  Favio will use this loan to buy accessories and parts to stock his stall, which will allow him to offer his customers better service and increase his profits.  He is asking for this loan to improve his business.  Favio will use his profits to keep buying parts and accessories wholesale.  Favio is a very hardworking person and he is glad to have the credit opportunity he has been offered.

loans.use: to buy vehicle accessories

loans.name: Marta Licet

texts.es:
Marta es una mujer emprendedora de 37 años de edad, casada y de su matrimonio tiene 6 hijos los cuales viven bajo su techo y ayudan con las diferentes actividades del campo que además son jóvenes estudiantes. Ella se dedica a la agricultura hace muchos años por lo cual tiene una vasta experiencia en dicha actividad. El producto es comercializado y vendido en la zona y en los alrededores donde ella habita muy popular por el carisma y la atención personalizada que ella y su esposo brindan a cada uno de sus clientes ya que para ellos son lo más importante en el negocio los cuales son los que hacen posible la comercialización de su producto.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para invertir en sus cultivos de granos básicos y café comprando abono, fertilizantes y otros productos que harán de su cultivo más seguro y confiable para su venta. 

Ella Sueña con tener una mejor variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y llevarlo hasta otras zonas para su comercialización ya que por medio de esto ella podrá generar ingresos para su hogar y podrá darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos permitiendo apoyarle con sus estudios y demás cosas que ellos necesiten. Así como también fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marta, 37, is an enterprising woman.  She's married and has six children.  They live at home and help with the different farming activities, and they're also young students.

She has earned a living in agriculture for many years, so she has broad experience.  She sells her product in the area and on the outskirts of where she lives.  She's very popular for her charisma and the personalized attention that she and her husband give each one of their customers.  The most important thing in the business for them is the people who make it possible for them to sell their product.

Currently she's requesting a loan to invest in her basic grain and coffee crops.  She's buying soil amendments, fertilizer, and other products that will make her crop more certain and reliable for sale.

She dreams of having a better variety of products to sell to her customers and to take the products to other areas to sell.  This way she'll be able to generate income for her household, give her children a better future, help them with their studies and other needs, and strengthen her assets for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and soil amendments for her corn, bean, and coffee crops

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Reina es una mujer emprendedora, luchadora de 52 años de edad, casada y de su matrimonio tiene 1 hijo el cual vive bajo su mismo techo y ayuda con las distintas actividades en el campo como ser: Limpieza, Abono, Fumigación y corte del producto como lo es el café. Ella tiene un grado de educación de primaria no completado cursado hasta el 4 grado por lo cual no pudo seguir estudiando debido a la falta de apoyo por parte de sus padres en ese entonces. Ella es Comerciante de su producto y también tiene una pequeña pulperia con la cual genera y ayuda a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Ella se dedica a la agricultura hace mucho tiempo y fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron desde muy temprana edad. Su producto es comercializado con los intermediarios que llegan a la zona y otros que son llegados a la cercanía y que la caracterizan su producto como un producto de calidad e higiénico. El terreno que ellos cultivan es propio y lo adquirieron por el esfuerzo impuesto por su pareja desde hace muchos años.

Hoy en día solicita ayuda para poder comprar semilla certificada de café y poderla sembrar para poder obtener ganancias y una cosecha segura.

Sus planes a futuro es tener una amplia plantación dando variedad a sus clientes y todos aquellos que consumen su producto para de esa forma poder generar más ingresos que vendrán a ayudar para fortalecer el patrimonio para su hijo y sus nietos y que sean ellos los que sigan trabajando la tierra de generación en generación.
texts.en:
Reina is an enterprising, hardworking 52-year-old woman.  She is married and has a son who lives under her roof and helps her with different kinds of fieldwork, such as cleaning, fertilization, fumigation, and cutting her coffee plants.  She has a fourth-grade education; she was not able to go further because her parents could not support her at the time.  She sells her produce and she also has a small grocery store that allows her to help her partner with the household expenses.  She has worked in farming for a long time and she was taught by parents when she was very young.  She sells her produce to the dealers who come to the area and to others who come around and they say her produce is good-quality and clean.  They own the land they cultivate and they were able to get it through years of her partner's hard work.  

She is currently asking for a loan to buy certified coffee seed and to plant it so she can make a profit and have a guaranteed harvest.

Her plan for the future is to have a big coffee plantation that offers variety to her customers and to everyone who consumes her produce.  This will allow her to make more income, which will help strengthen the inheritance she leaves her child and grandchildren so that they can work the land from generation to generation.

loans.use: to buy certified coffee seed to plant

loans.name: Koeju Group

texts.es:
Koeju es un grupo de mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupé, ellas por medio del trabajo que están haciendo, han pasado a un nuevo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras. Son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren dar a sus hijos y familiares todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
La señora Alicia es integrante del comité,  ella cuenta se dedica a la venta de ropas, y que por medio de sus ventas está ayudando a su familia. Es una persona con grandes ansias de crecer, lucha por su familia y se esfuerza siempre mucho por salir adelante. Cuenta que quiere tener un salón donde pueda dar a sus clientes todo lo que necesiten.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de todo tipo, como ser remeras, camisas, pantalones, y demás, para que así siga con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
“Koeju” is a group of women from the city of Caacupé. Due to the work they have accomplished, these women have advanced to their ninth loan cycle as part of the Women Entrepreneurs Program. These female heads of household want to provide their children and family members everything that they could not have.

Sra. Alicia is a member of this committee. She sells clothing and is able to help her family as a result of her sales. Alicia is very eager to grow, so she is always striving very hard to move forward on behalf of her family. She says that she would like to have a shop where she can offer everything that her customers need.

Alicia is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of clothing of all types, such as T-shirts, shirts, trousers, and other items. As a result, she can continue her sales just as she has always done.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, shirts, trousers, and other items.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Isidro está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una pone su pequeño grano de arena para poder seguir creciendo y también por medio de ese trabajo poder ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Edelmira, quien se dedica a la venta de terere y de hierbas medicinales. El terere es una bebida tradicional paraguaya, que se hace a base de hierbas medicinales, lo cual todos los días los paraguayos la toman, haga frio o calor. Ella cuenta que le está yendo muy bien en sus ventas, ya que hace tiempo que se dedica a esto y esta ya con una clientela bien formada.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra mesitas para que pueda exhibir encima de ello sus remedios naturales, lo que le ayudará a seguir con sus ventas y seguir ofreciendo buenos productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Isidro" is in its fourth loan cycle, and each member contributes her little grain of sand so the group can continue growing and helping their families.

One of the members, Edelmira, sells tereré and medicinal herbs.  Tereré is a traditional Paraguan beverage made from medicinal herbs which Paraguayans drink every day, rain or shine.  She says business is going very well because she has been doing this for some time now and has a good customer base.

Edelmira is requesting a loan to buy tables to display her natural remedies.  This will help with sales so she can continue offering good products to her customers.

loans.use: To buy tables to display natural medicines.

loans.name: Kamodiya

texts.en:
Kamodiya, 51-year-old married woman from Ghoghariya-07 Village Development Committee of Bara District, is married to Rambalak and has two sons. Both she and her husband are involved in the tanga (bull cart) transportation business, an enterprise they started with a loan of NPR 2000 eight years ago.

Kamodiya's life was full of problems and hardship before starting the tanga businesses, but as a result of this enterprise her family no longer lives in poverty. She has requested a loan of NPR 15000.00 to repair the tanga. She has a plan to expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to pay for repair of the tanga (bull cart)

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en:
A man with a generous soul and a kind heart needs your help, as he has found himself in financial difficulties. Hamid is married and has four children who live in Haja, Yemen. He is a teacher who is paid a small salary.

The climate in Hamid’s region allows for raising livestock. He would like to do so, but the amount he has saved is not enough to buy some. So Hamid is applying for a 199,999 YER loan through AMB to buy a cow, sheep and some goats. He is planning to use the eventual profits from this loan to provide his children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy a cow, sheep and some goats.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Las 18 integrantes de este grupo son personas muy trabajadoras que luchan por sus familias para poder darles todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener, quieren que sus hijos no pasen por ningún tipo de necesidades. Ellas vieron una gran oportunidad de progreso en el programa de comité de mujeres de la fundación.
Elva, una de las integrantes se dedica a la producción y venta de dulces, cuenta que le está yendo muy bien en su trabajo ya que sus dulces son muy aceptados por sus clientes. Ella se esfuerza día a día, y cuenta que empieza a trabajar desde tempranas horas. Su sueño es podre tener una gran tienda de dulces y seguir de esa forma con su microemprendimiento.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus dulces, como ser azúcar, guayaba, frutas, edulcorantes y demás.
texts.en:
The 18 members of this group are very hardworking people who fight for their families to give them everything they themselves couldn't have. They want their children not to have to experience any type of need.  They saw a great opportunity for progress in the women's committee in the foundation. 

Elva, one of the members, works making and selling sweets. She says that it is going very well for her in her work because her sweets are very much accepted by her customers. She works day to day and says that she starts working very early in the morning. Her dream is to be able to have a great candy store and being able to continue in this way with her micro-business. She is asking for this loan to buy ingredients to keep making her sweets, such as sugar, guayaba, fruit, sweeteners and more.

loans.use: to buy sugar, guayaba, fruit, sweeteners, and more.

loans.name: 14 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 14 de agosto está en su ciclo número 5° del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras que vieron una gran oportunidad para ellas y sus familias por medio del comité.
Zunilda es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza, los cuales compra en forma de microfranquicia que les provee la fundación paraguaya. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por poder dar a su familia todo lo que no pudo tener.
Solicita este crédito para la compra de microfranquicias de limpieza, para poder revender y de esa forma seguir ofreciendo a su clientela todo lo que necesita.
texts.en: The group called “14 de agosto” is in its fifth cycle in the women’s committee.  They are very hardworking women who recognized a great opportunity for them and their families in the committee.  Zunilda is part of this group.  She sells cleaning supplies she buys in mini franchises that Fundación Paraguaya provides.  She’s a very hardworking woman who strives to give her family everything she was unable to have.  She’s requesting this loan to buy micro franchises of cleaning supplies to resell thus continuing to offer her customers everything they need.

loans.use: to buy micro franchises to resell.

loans.name: Maiywa

texts.en:
Maiywa is 31 years old and a married woman, from Ghoghariya-7 Village Development committee, of Bara District. She is married to Rambali and has three sons and one daughter. They have started a tanga business. (A "tanga" is a cart like the one in the profile photo, which is used to transport local passengers.) They began the business six years ago, using capital from a Nirdhan Utthan Bank loan.

Their tanga business is performing well. They have earned respect in the community.  Maiywa has requested a loan in the amount of Nepalese Rupees (NPR) 60,000. (Sixty thousand). She will use the loan to purchase another tanga and expand the business. Her plan for the future is to buy a house, and to send the children to a good school, from the earnings of the business.

loans.use: to buy an additional tanga (bull cart), to enlarge the family business, transporting passengers

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is forty years old and is a hardworking and industrious worker. For the past five years she has sold underwear in Dansoman where she is doing a good business.

Grace joined ID Ghana in 2010 when a friend told her about it. This will be her seventh loan, and she is applying for a 1,000 GHS loan to buy more underwear to meet her customers’ demands.

loans.use: to buy more underwear to sell.

loans.name: Freddy Fabian

texts.es:
El cliente Freddy vive en Quevedo. Crecio en la finca con sus padres ellos tenían hectáreas de frutas que conservaban y animales como (cerdos que alimentaban de plátano). Fue asi que también heredo la pasión por criar cerdos y recolectar frutas.

El hace su trabajo con su conviviente, sus hijos todas las mañanas hasta las 7h00 que comienzan las clases.
La dificultad que tiene en su negocio es su enfermedad ya que hay veces que no puede trabajar normalmente. Si está casado, es ama de casa y lo ayuda en el trabajo del campo. Si tiene 3 hijos los cuales están en escuela fiscal. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, materiales de construccion para mejorar las jaulas de los cerdos y balanceado. Su sueño es tener una granja de producción de cerdos y distribución de frutas.
texts.en:
Freddy lives in Quevedo.  He grew up on the farm with his parents.  They had hectares of fruit that they conserved, and they had animals like pigs, which they fed with bananas.  That is how he inherited the passion for raising pigs and picking fruit.

He does his work with his life partner and his children until 7:00 when classes start.

The difficulty that he has in is business is his state of health.  At times he is not able to work as he normally does.  He is married.  His wife is a housewife, and she helps him with the field work.  He has three children, and they go to public school.

He wants to use the loan to buy cement and construction materials to improve the pigpens.  He will also buy balanced feed.

His dream is to have a farm producing pigs and distributing fruit.

loans.use: to buy cement, construction materials, and balanced feed.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Sarita is a 28-year-old, married woman from Mahespur Villiage, of Bara district. She is married to Harishankar and has one son and one daughter. They are operating the business of cultivation and threshing, with their tractor. She has requested the loan amount of Nepalese Rs (NPR) 100,000. Sarita will use the loan to buy another tractor, so that they can expand the business.

She remembers her earlier days, which were full of hardship. But their business, started with loan capital borrowed from Nirdhan Bank, has helped her to overcome her bad days. They have a good business now, and have earned good respect as successful entrepreneurs. She wants to give her children good higher education.

loans.use: to buy another tractor for their business of providing cultivation and threshing services to farmers

loans.name: Abdulrhman

texts.en:
Abdulrhman is a 41-year-old man. He is married and lives with his children in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a very happy, energetic man. He is employed in an education office and works in the morning; he gets a low salary. He has another source of income which is a taxi, and he works in the afternoon to cover his family’s expenses.  

He has saved up money, but does not have enough for buying furniture. He has decided to apply for a loan of 274,999 YER from AMB to buy furniture for his house. He hopes that he will be supported and lenders will help him to realize his plans.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas, 27, is a very dedicated and hardworking individual. He lives in Glefe in the Dansoman region. For the past eight years he has worked servicing cell phones and is doing very well.

Thomas joined ID Ghana in August, 2012 when he heard about it from another client. He has since taken two loans and is now applying for a 1,200 GHS loan to buy more equipment to sell to his customers in the community.

loans.use: to buy more equipment to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Librada, se conformó con la iniciativa de la señora Cirila;  Actualmente se encuentran  en el cuarto ciclo, con 16 integrantes, a 35 km de  Curuguaty.
Cirila, quien es también la presidenta, cuenta que siempre trata de motivar a sus amigas a luchar y trabajar, no solo por sus familias sino también por la comunidad, ya que están en una zona muy lejana. Cirila se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de granja, como ser cabras, vacas, gallinas y demás, además de eso cuenta que es un trabajo muy difícil y de tiempo completo ya que debe de estar siempre pendiente de sus animales.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales y también para la compra de animales pequeños para la cría.
texts.en: The Santa Librada communal bank was started with the initiative of Cirila. Currently, they are on their fourth loan cycle with 16 members. They are 35 km from Curuguaty. Cirila, who is also the chairwoman of the group, says that she always tries to motivate her friends to strive and work, not only for their families, but for the community, since they are in a very remote area. Cirila works raising and selling farm animals, like goats, cows, hens, and more. She says that this is difficult, full-time work, because she always has to look after her animals. She is asking for this loan to buy feed for her animals and also to buy small animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy feed and small animals to raise.

loans.name: San Carlos Group

texts.es:
12 mujeres de la ciudad de Encarnación se unieron para trabajar juntas, hoy ya están en su segundo ciclo. Ellas desean poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa de comité de mujeres, y es por ello que están trabajando duro.
Noelia, quien es parte de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de frutas y de verduras, de todo tipo. Ella cuenta que es muy conocida por los buenos productos que vende, ya tiene una clientela bien formada que siempre compra de ella lo que les ofrece. Noelia comenta que su meta es poder tener una gran tienda de frutas y de verduras y de esa forma seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas y de verduras, ya que con ello puede seguir con sus ventas y generar los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Twelve women from Encarnacion city formed a group in order to work together, and now they are requesting their second loan. They want to be able to get to the highest level of the women's committee program, and that is why they are working hard. Noelia, who is a member of the group, sells all kinds of fruits and vegetables. She says that she is very well-known for the good quality products that she sells. She has an established clientele who always come to her for these goods. Noelia says that her goal is to have a large grocery store and in this way to continue giving a good service to her customers. She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in fruits and vegetables and carry on selling and generating income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is 42 years old, married and the father of seven children who live in Haja, Yemen. He is a teacher who earns a small salary. He is a hardworking man who faces a difficult challenge to provide for his family’s needs. 

He plans to raise livestock for selling, so he can earn a good profit. He is requesting a loan of 250,000 YER to buy livestock, including sheep and goats, for resale. 

Mahdi will use the additional income he earns to repay this loan, to cover the cost of paying for his children's education and to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy livestock, including sheep and goats, for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more stock to sell to their respective customers.

loans.name: Nancy Group

texts.en:
This group consists of four members who reside in Dansoman. They are Nancy, Ramatu, Cynthia and Vida. They have been together since June 2008 and are still doing very well. They sell eggs, ladies' wear, ladies' footwear, and mixed items, respectively.

Nancy, the leader, is 32 years old and an egg seller. She has been doing this for the past five years. Through her dedication and seriousness in her business, she has been able to build up trust with ID Ghana. 

Now on her fourth loan, she is requesting to borrow the amount of GHS 3,000. The loan will help her boost the business and satisfy her customers in and around the community.

The entire group, together, needs GHS 5,900. They each will use their share to buy more goods, to resell to their respective customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more eggs to resell to her customers

loans.name: Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Luchadoras está en su ciclo número uno del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una de las miembros se esfuerza y lucha por poder dar a sus familias todo lo que necesitan para no tener que pasar por privaciones como las que ellas tuvieron que pasar.
Mirian es parte de este grupo, es una mujer muy emprendedora, que por medio de la venta de comestibles, es decir, comidas rápidas, está ayudando a sus parientes. Comenta que con el tiempo se a hecho de muy buena clientela y que le está yendo muy bien.
Ella solicita de esta ayuda para poder invertirla en la compra de carnes, verduras, condimentos, y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo los comestibles que vende, ya que sus clientes le hacen muchos pedidos.
texts.en:
This group, Luchadoras, is on its first loan cycle in the program for women's communal banks, in which each one of the members works and fights to be able to give their families everything they need, so that their families do not have to go without like the women did. 

Mirian is part of this group. She is a very enterprising women, who by selling food, or rather, fast food, is helping her family. She says that over time, she has gained a lot of customers and that it is going well for her. She is asking for this help to be able to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, and other ingredients to be able to keep making the food that she sells, since her customers are placing a lot of orders.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Tilda Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of three members who have been accessing loans from ID Ghana since 2012. They are Matilda, Evelyn, and Adiza. They live in Dansoman. Matilda is a pepper seller, Evelyn sells provisions, and Adiza sells charcoal, respectively.

ID Ghana has been of great service to them since they have been able to grow their small businesses through the credit scheme. 

Matilda is a 45-year-old pepper seller. She has seven years experience. She works six days in a week (Monday to Saturday). She is constantly working to improve on her business capital. This is her second loan with ID Ghana and she is requesting an amount of GHS 600 to buy more to sell to her customers in the community.

The entire group needs a total amount of GHS 1,700 for business expansion and to meet customers’ demand.

loans.use: To buy more peppers and sell to customers.

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.ru: Гулдаста жительница города Вахдат. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем и является матерью троих детей. Гулдаста обеспечивает семью за счет торговли. У нее на рынке города имеется магазин, где она продает продукты питания, в частности: чай, сахар, печенье, шоколад, майонез, кетчуп, консервированные продукты, фруктовые соки и т.д. Гулдаста занимается продажей в течение 10 лет. Она очень любит свой бизнес и сейчас хотела бы увеличить товарооборот. С этой целью Гулдаста запрашивает кредит для закупа продуктов питания в свой магазин.
texts.en: Guldasta lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 50 years old. She is married and has three children. Guldasta provides for her family by working as a vendor. She has a stall at the local market, where she sells food items, such as tea, sugar, cookies, chocolate, mayonnaise, ketchup, canned [tinned] food, fruit juices etc. Guldasta has been in retail for over 10 years. She really likes her business and would like to increase her sales volume at present. With this goal, Guldasta is applying for a loan to stock up on food items for her stall.

loans.use: to stock up on food items so as to increase her sales volume.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German es un hombre de 68 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Jayanca con su esposa y sus siete hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, German no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por el campo y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, German trabaja como ganadero, el cuenta con un pequeño número de animales entre carneros, ovejas, chivos y otros, los cuales cría para luego venderlos en los mercados de su ciudad, German trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
German se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de los servicios higiénicos de su vivienda, ya que actualmente cuenta con un silo, de esta manera German y su familia podrán contar con mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
German is a 68-year-old man who lives in the city of Chiclayo, in the district of Jayanca, with his wife and seven children. He loves them very much and they are his main reason for living. He is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person. He and his wife put their all into getting their family ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and because of the necessity to get a job at a very young age, German was unable to study business administration as he had wanted. In his free time, he likes to walk in the fields and he sometimes cooks delicious fried rice.
On his own initiative, with great hard work and dedication, German works in livestock. He has a small number of animals - rams, sheep, goats, and others - which he raises to later sell in the city markets. German works every day for approximately ten hours and believes that it is going well for him because of his experience and his kind treatment of others.
German is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to improve his home's hygienic services. He currently has only a pit latrine. This way, German and his family will be able to have better security and well-being. He will continue working hard to achieve his great dream of finishing construction on his home.

loans.use: to improve his home's hygiene.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de Itá, está en su ciclo numero 8, ellas son 19 mujeres que vieron una esperanza en el programa de la fundación, ya que les permite ayudarse, no solo las unas a las otras sino también a sus hijos y familias.
Margareth, una de las miembros, cuenta que vende zapatos de toda clase, para hombres como para mujeres, tiene toda variedad de calzados y eso la ayuda a poder tener buena clientela y buena venta. Empezó con pequeñas ventas, pero gracias a que es buena para las ventas le está yendo muy bien.
Esta solicitando de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de calzados, y de esa forma seguir teniendo buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece por la ayuda que ella y sus amigas están recibiendo, por ser esta una gran oportunidad.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Ita. They are on their eighth loan cycle. They are 19 women who saw hope in the foundation's program, because it helps them to help themselves, not just each other, but also their children and families. 

Margareth, one of the members, says that she sells all kinds of shoes, for men and women. She has a variety of footwear, and this helps her get good customers and have good sales. She started with small sales, but because she is good at sales, it is going very well for her. She is asking for this loan to buy footwear, and this way, continue to have a wide variety to offer to her customers. She is thankful for the help that she and her friends are receiving, because it is a good opportunity.

loans.use: to buy footwear to sell.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 8 de Diciembre está en su ciclo número  2 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, son mujeres jefas de familia que deciden luchar por sus familias y tomar las riendas y no dejarse vencer por nada.
La Sra. Sonia es una de las integrantes, es limpiadora y con su crédito desea tener un pequeño negocio de  una despensa, quiere poder emprender esto, ya que de esa forma podrá tener mayor ingreso que poder dar a su familia. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de la fundación pueda ir creciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras, frutas, fideos, arroz, harina, productos a granel varios y demás insumos para poder utilizarlos para surtir su despensa.
texts.en: The December 8th group are requesting their second loan from the women's committee program. The group is from the city of Caaguazu, and all are women and the breadwinners for their families who have decided to fight for their families by taking the reins and never letting anything beat them. Sonia is one of the members. She is a cleaner and wants to use her loan to start a small convenience store so that she can generate more income for her family. She hopes that over time, and with the help of the foundation, she will be able to grow. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy vegetables, fruits, noodles, rice, flour, and other supplies in bulk so that she can stock her store.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, noodles, rice, flour,  and other supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Divino Niño Jesus está en su ciclo número 2º del programa de comité, donde cada una de las integrantes pone su pequeño grano de arena `para poder salir adelante, crecer como microemprendedoras y ayudar a su familia.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien se dedica a la venta de frutas de estación, ella es una persona muy dedicada a su familia, lucha por ellos, para poder darles todo lo que necesitan y de esa forma evitar que pasen por privaciones de alguna clase. Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de frutas, como ser bananas, manzanas, piñas, melones aguacates y demás para poder surtir su negocio y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: The “Divine Baby Jesus” Group is beginning their second loan cycle. Each one of the members contributes to the group, like a small grain of sand, so that the whole group can move forward as entrepreneurs and help their families. One of the members of the group is Mrs. Mary. She sells the fruit of the season. She is a person that is very dedicated to her family. She fights for them in order to give them all that they need. In this way they do not feel as deprived as others in their economic class. She is asking for this loan in order to buy fruit such as bananas, apples, pineapples, melons, avocados and other fruit in order to offer a greater variety of items in her business. In this manner she can continue selling fruit as she has done in the past.

loans.use: to buy bananas, apples, pineapple, melon, avocados and other items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Omarfo Group

texts.en:
Mary and Rose are partners in this loan group which has been together since 2012. They both live within the Dansoman community. Mary, 28, is married to Francis, a 35-year-old driver. They are blessed with a child who is in school.

Mary sells secondhand clothes (Rose is a hairdresser). For the past three years she has worked Mondays through Saturdays. Thanks to ID Ghana’s training regarding savings, she has made it this far and is doing very well.

Mary is applying for a third group loan of 1,700 GHS for Patricia and herself. She will use her 900 GHS portion to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 28-year-old ladies underwear seller. She is married to Ankamah, a 30-year-old driver. They have a child. 

In 2012, she needed to expand her business and she was introduced to ID Ghana through a friend. She has been doing her business for the past six years. She is a hardworking, industrious, and committed individual ready to go the extra mile. 

This is her third loan and she needs GHS 900 to buy more underwear to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more ladies underwear to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 60 años, vive en compañía de su esposa Isabel y juntos tienen 6 hijos, de los cuales solo viven con dos de ellos en su casa propia.Juan se dedica a la agricultura razon por la cual cuenta con sus terrenos de cultivos los cuales pudo adquirir con mucho esfuerzo , ahí siembra papa y arveja que es lo que más le gusta, pues adquiere ganancias mensualmente y son productos con mayor demanda. En el mercado central de su localidad; los negociantes le brindan un buen precio de compra , por ello él, está pensando adquirir más terrenos de cultivo, donde no solo sembrará papa sino tambien otros productos de su zona.Este es el cuarto crédito con KIVA, y esta contento por el apoyo financiero que recibe , asimismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Juan, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Juan, age 60, lives with his wife Isabel. They have six children together. Only two of them live with them in their own home. Juan is a farmer, so he has land which he was able to acquire with a lot of hard work. He sows potatoes and peas, which he most likes to do because it makes him a monthly income and these are the products with the greatest demand in the central market in his area. The businesses give him a good purchase price. He is thinking of buying more land to farm. He will sow not only potato but also other local produce. This is his fourth loan on Kiva. He is happy to have this financial support. He promises to be punctual with the payment of his quotas. Juan will invest the 1,000 soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to provide nutrients to his crops.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flowers, wallets, all types of clothing, shoes, perfume, and other items.

loans.name: Gbe Group

texts.en:
Beatrice, 36, is a single parent with one child. She and Mary are partners in this loan group, which has been together since 2012. They both live within the Dansoman community.

Beatrice is a hairdresser (Mary sells maize). For the past ten years she has worked Mondays through Saturdays. Thanks to ID Ghana she is doing very well. She has been able to provide her child with a quality education.

Beatrice is applying for a fourth group loan of 2,100 GHS for Mary and herself. She will invest her 1,400 GHS portion in her hairdressing business. She is grateful to ID Ghana for these loans.

loans.use: to invest in her hairdressing business.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 42 years old and a secondhand clothing seller. She is married to Theophilus, a 45-year-old driver. They are blessed with two children. She has been in this business for the past six years and is doing very well. She has been a member of ID Ghana since 2010, which she found through another beneficiary of the credit scheme. 

She is a very dedicated and hardworking individual. 

She has since taken five loans from ID Ghana and has been able to repay without any default. She is applying for her sixth loan and needs GHS 900 to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers in the community in Dansoman.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis is a 36-year-old tomato/onion seller. She is married to Patrick, a 37-year-old trader. She joined ID Ghana in 2011 when she was introduced by a friend.

She has been in this trade for the past six years and is still doing very excellent in the Dansoman community. She is hardworking and industrious.
 
This is her eighth loan and she needs a loan in the amount of GHS 800 to buy more tomatoes to meet her customers demand.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell to customers.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité San Cayetano es de la zona de San Lorenzo son 16 integrantes  muy responsables y trabajadoras se reúnen siempre para resolver cualquier inconveniente que pueda surgir, se ayudan y están trabajando arduamente juntas.
Una de ellas es la señora Rosa, quien se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza, los cuales puede hacer gracias a las microfranquicias que la fundación paraguaya les ofrece. Gracias a esto tiene un mejor margen de ganancia y puede ayudar a su familia con ello. Es una persona que demuestra mucho interés y ganas de salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de microfranquicias, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano communal bank is from the San Lorenzo area. It is made up of 16 responsible and hard-working members who always meet to solve any problem that may arise. They help each other and they are working hard together. 

Rosa is one of them. She works selling cleaning products, which she can do thanks to the micro-franchises that Fundación Paraguaya offers them. Thanks to this, she has a higher profit margin and she can use it to help her family. She is a person who has a lot of interest in and drive to move forward. She is asking for this loan to buy micro-franchises, and continue her sales this way.

loans.use: to buy cleaning micro-franchises to sell.

loans.name: Sirgboh

texts.en:
Sirgboh is a 32-year-old woman who sells polythene bags. She resides in the Dansoman community.

She has been in this business for the past three years and is still doing very well. She is very good and discreet when it comes to her business. 

This is her first loan and needs an amount of GHS 400 to expand her business and buy more goods to enable her to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria’s high-interest loans were hindering the growth of her business. She has been in business for herself for more than six years and has a staff of four employees. "B&J Cuts and Fades" offers professional haircuts for both men and women.

Maria fell into a trap that has hurt many other people – she borrowed money from predatory lenders that charged her interest rates as high as 180 percent annually. Her business began to suffer due to these high interest rates. She was making payments on the interest and not making a dent on her principal. She couldn’t invest in her business. But all this was about to change – once a local bank referred her to ACCION Texas Inc. The loan she received from ACCION enabled Maria to refinance her debt and use the extra cash flow to invest into her business.

Maria focuses more on her clients now and on getting new business and making improvements within her shop. The stress of high-interest loans are behind her now. Maria also was able to educate herself about credit history and keeping financial reports with the help of ACCION. Her plans are to continue offering great customer service and haircuts to her customers. She has all her focus on her salon and is ready for the future.

loans.use: to refinance a loan, advertise and purchase supplies.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is a 28-year-old man who sells jeans. He resides in the Dansoman community.

He has been in this business for the past five years and is doing very well. He joined ID Ghana in 2013 and was introduced through another beneficiary. He is a very dedicated and hardworking individual. 

This is his first loan and needs GHS 400 to buy more jeans to sell to his customers in the community.

loans.use: To by more goods to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Las Amapolas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Amapolas está en su ciclo número 4to del programa de comité de mujeres, según la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual es un medio para poder conocer la situación económica de cada una, 4 de las mujeres se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir, con un ingreso muy bajo.
Justa es una de las integrantes de este grupo, quien es una persona muy talentosa y trabajadora, es muy buena en lo que hace y es por eso que le está yendo muy bien. Se dedica a la costura y es gracias a esto que tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Son sus mismos clientes quienes le hacen publicidad, ya que hace muy buen trabajo siempre. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe, ya que no solo la ayudará a ella, sino también a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones, cierres y demás insumos para seguir con sus costuras y pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Amapolas" is in its fourth loan cycle of the women's committee program.  According the survey on elimination of poverty, which is a way of determining each member's economic situation, four of these women are below the poverty line with a very low income.

Justa is one of the members of the group and she is a talented, hard-working person.  She is very good at what she does and this is why things are going well for her.  She works as a seamstress to earn a living to support her family.  Her customers are her best publicity because she always does a good job.  She is grateful for this opportunity because it will help not only her but also her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, closures and other supplies so she can continue sewing and filling customer orders.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, closures, etc.

loans.name: Cenda De Amor Group

texts.es: Este es un grupo formado por tres socias microempresarias una de ellas es Patricia mujer con 29 años de edad, soltera con un hijo menor de 9 años de edad. Su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva, ropa usada desde hace 10 años consecutivos, anteriormente trabajaba como doméstica, en casa privadas. De estar en la institución tiene 8 meses de ser sujeta de préstamos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa nueva como pantalones de varón, pantalones de mujer, camisas de damas, camisas de varón, chores, camisetas, faldas, brasieres, bikinis etc. Mercedes mujer de 53 años de edad y su negocio es la hecha y venta de tortilla en su domicilio y venta de productos derivados del cerdo como frito, cabeza de chancho, nacatamales los fines de semanas y Sandra tiene 40 años y su negocio es tener un kiosco estudiantil en un colegio cercano a su domicilio, vende gaseosas variadas, reposterías, chiverías, jugos de caja, jugos de lata etc.
texts.en:
This is a group of three small business owners, one of whom is Patricia, age 29. She is single with one child, age 9. She has sold new and used clothing for 10 consecutive years. Before that, she worked as a maid in private homes. She first took out a loan with the institution 8 months ago. She will invest this loan in the purchase of new clothing such as men's and women's pants, men's and women's shirts, shorts, skirts, bras, bikinis, etc.
Mercedes, a 53-year-old woman, makes and sells tortillas in her  home. She also sells pork products such as fried pork, cabeza de chancho [a stew], and nactamales on the weekends. Sandra is 40, and she has a kiosk for school children at a school near to her home. She sells a variety of pop, confectionery,
dairy products, juice boxes, canned juice, etc.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing like men's and women's pants, men's and women's shirts, shorts, skirts, bras, bikinis, etc.

loans.name: 13 Belen Group

texts.es:
El comité 13 Belen son todas de la zona de San Lorenzo son 18 integrantes  muy responsables, todas participaron del programa de eliminación de pobreza en el año 2011 y año 2012 el cual les permite saber en qué estado están sus ingresos. Hoy todas están en un nivel con buenos ingresos. Todas son mamas muy responsables y trabajadoras se reúnen siempre para resolver cualquier problema del grupo y ayudan a su comunidad.
Maria es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales que son para mates y terere (bebidas tradicionales paraguayas). Ella cuenta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, pero que lo hace por ayudar a su familia, ella quiere poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener y es por ellos que se sacrifica.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de medicina natural, y así poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo hasta hoy.
texts.en:
All 18 members of the committee named “13 Belen” are from the District of San Lorenzo and are very responsible.  All of them participated in the Poverty Elimination Program in 2011 and 2012 so that they could know the state of their incomes.  Today they are all at a good income level.  All of the members are responsible and hardworking mothers who always gather together to resolve any problems within the group and to help their community.  

Maria is one of the members of this group.  She sells natural remedies such as “mate” and “tereré” (traditional Paraguayan beverages).  Maria’s work requires great sacrifice, but it enables her to help her family.  She wants to provide them everything so that they do not have to live without.  This is the reason why she is willing to make sacrifices.  

Maria is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of natural medicines.  As a result, she will be able to continue her sales in the same manner as she has until now.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines to sell.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  San Isidro está integrado por 20 mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, están en  el ciclo 1°  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante ya que todas forman parte de comisiones  agrícolas de la zona. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 7 de ellas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Flordelina, quien se dedica a la venta de productos agrícolas, también hace todo tipo de comestibles, y cuando puede se las ingenia y vende cualquier cosa, como ser prendas o calzados, como se ve, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que lucha por su familia, para poder darles todo lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones. Su sueño es seguir creciendo para tener un mejor ingreso.
La Sra. Solicita este crédito para la compra de  insumos para poder utilizarlos en la elaboración de comestibles y también para la compra de ciertas prendas. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Isidro" is comprised of 20 hard-working, enterprising women who are in their first loan cycle.  They all work and help each other get ahead since all of them form part of the farming community in the area.

They are taking the poverty elimination survey, where 7 members are below the poverty line.  One of the members, Flordelina, sells farm products and all kinds of food products.  When she can, she sells anything, even clothing or shoes.  As you can see, she is a very hard-working person who struggles for her family so she can give them everything they need so they will not go without anything.

Her goal is to continue growing to improve her income.  Flordelina is requesting a loan to buy food supplies and also some clothing.  She is grateful for this opportunity for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy food supplies and some clothing.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima is a 45-year-old married lady who is a mother of nine sons and daughters. While her husband works as a driver to support the family, Rima started a clothing sales business at home, selling kids' clothing items as a start. Living in an area where there is a lot of children is helping Rima to have more and more customers, which is why she applied for a loan to increase the quantity she has of children's clothes to cover the neighborhood’s demand.

loans.use: to increase the quantity she has of children's clothes to sell

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es:
Fortunato nació en la ciudad de Salvación y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú). 

Fortunato tiene 24 años de edad y es soltero, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante y su actividad económica principal es la agricultura, el tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra plátanos, yucas y maíz. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la agricultura y ve la muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmeras del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y  otras cosas. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Fortunato was born in the city of Salvación and currently lives there as well. (Salvación is located in the district of Manu, in the province of Manu, Madre de Dios department, Peru).
Fortunato is 24 and single. He is a hard-working and enterprising person who is getting ahead. His main economic activity is agriculture. He has several plots of land where he sows banana, yucca and corn. He has worked in agriculture for several years and it is going very well for him thanks to the hard work he puts into his job. He belongs to the "Las Palmeras del Manu" communal bank, and currently needs a loan for the purchase of seeds and other items. He values this loan and is grateful for it. He promises to repay his monthly quotas.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other items.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Maria Matilde

texts.es: Doña Maria vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos de 19 y 17 años de edad, ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maíz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es una mujer  responsable, honesta y trabajadora. Ella  está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, pesticidas, herbicidas, semillas, etc. ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y así tener mejores ingresos y tener un mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en: Maria lives in her own home with her two children, ages 17 and 19. She has worked in agriculture for several years and sows beans and corn. With her income she is able to cover her household's costs. She is a responsible, honest, and hard-working woman. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of supplies such as fertilizer, manure, pesticides, herbicides, and seeds. This is because her income is not enough to cover these costs. With this loan, she will be able to make more income and have greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, etc.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos was originally in real estate up until the housing market diminished. Frustrated, the 35-year-old wanted to start over with a new career.  Searching for a new business idea, Carlos found apps and it felt like home. 

Myriad Co. began in June 2011, developing cell phone applications. One product, Fishing for Words, is an app inspired by Carlos’ love for fishing.  He even has professional fisherman Bill Dance sponsoring the project to promote awareness.  The app is similar to the well-known game, Words with Friends, but with a twist.  The major difference will be that Fishing for Words will have a dictionary to define words, a rating system, 15- and 30-minute game timers for those looking for a short game and it can be played in Spanish, Japanese and French.

Working in his hometown of Memphis, Tenn., Carlos already has an app on the market, an automatic-reply app for Android called Autovoxt. Carlos says he wanted a job where he could relax and still get paid, and once he saw the demand for apps, “I saw the vision and I studied the market.” 

“No one taught me. The Internet and Google are your best tools,” he says.  However, a background in computers helped. Carlos works as an IT administrator at a hospital where his coworkers are familiar with his side job. One co-worker advised him to visit Service Corps of Retired Executives (SCORE), a local free confidential counseling nonprofit organization for start-up businesses seeking advice, in Memphis, for financial support. 

They referred him to Accion Texas Inc.  He used the Accion loan to finish the Fishing for Words app process, but mainly to create business cards and posters that have the app logo and instructions on how to download it. 

“My goal is to get 10,000 downloads the first week,” he says. 

His long-term goals are to hire those he contracts with in United States, Japan and India. “We have plans, if this expands, then these people will come under my umbrella. They’ll move to Memphis and be my employees.”

“What separates the market is what separates Apple from PC. I have lots of ideas for apps. I compare myself to Myspace and Facebook. Myspace began the need for social media, but Facebook revved it up,” he says. “Apps begin with the ideas. It’s not so much about the company but the person.”

Fishing for Words can be downloaded for iPhone and Android, including computers, tablets, and Facebook.

Visit his developing website at www.fishing4words.com/ and his Facebook page at: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Fishing-For-Words/146730425437084.

loans.use: to finish his project and advertize it.

loans.name: Giuliana

texts.en:
This loan will help Giuliana repair her business after damage from Hurricane Sandy.

Originally from Italy, Giuliana worked as a financial advisor on Wall Street for many years. During her time in New York, she became interested in nutrition, yoga, and juice cleanses. Six years ago, Giuliana decided it was time to pursue her passion full-time and quit her banking job to open her own business, The Juicy Naam. She sells juices and smoothies, provides guidance on how to perform nutritional cleanses and detox therapies, and offers massage and reflexology sessions. 

Giuliana has two locations: one in Sag Harbor, where she hires three full-time employees; and one in East Hampton, where she hires five employees during the busy season from May to September. When Hurricane Sandy struck in October 2012, she lost power in Sag Harbor from the intense flooding, and returned to broken windows and a ruined floor at her East Hampton location. Giuliana had the finances to only repair one location and she now needs a loan to recover her store-front in Sag Harbor.  This loan would help Giuliana purchase a new refrigerator unit and to repurchase lost inventory in time for her busiest season.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and needed inventory that were damaged in Hurricane Sandy

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a 32-year-old secondhand clothing seller. She is married to Mensah, a 35-year-old tailor. They have a child. She joined ID Ghana on the 8th of January 2013, when she was introduced by a friend.

She has been in this trade for the past four years and is still doing very excellent in the Dansoman community. She is hardworking and industrious.
 
This is her first loan and she needs a loan amount of GHS 400 to buy more goods to meet her customers demand.

loans.use: To buy more good to satisfy customers demands.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
Fátima es una mujer emprendedora de 32 años en una relación en estado civil de unión libre con un grado de educación de primaria completo lo cual agradase a sus padres por el apoyo brindado. Junto a su pareja tienen 2 hijos y en familia se dedican a la agricultura en lo que es la siembra de hortalizas y al cultivo de café desde hace mucho tiempo. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron dicha actividad y que hasta hoy en día siguen practicando ya que es medio de ingreso para su familia. Su producto es comercializado con los intermediarios que llegan a la zona y que la caracterizan su producto como un producto de calidad e higiénico. El terreno que ellos cultivan es propio y lo adquirieron gracias a una herencia que su padre  les dio para que ellos pudiesen cultivar su producto y poder obtener ingresos para su familia.

Hoy en día solicita ayuda para poder comprar fertilizantes, abono, plaguicidas para sus cultivos de café y darle mantenimiento a sus hortalizas ya que esto vendrá a aumentar las ganancias y a asegurar el producto que al final de la cosecha obtendrán.

Sus planes a futuro es tener una amplia plantación de café para de esa forma poder generar más ingresos que vendrán a ayudar para poder cubrir los estudios de sus hijos, sus alimentos y otros que son necesarios para la vida.
texts.en:
Fatima is an entrepreneurial 32-year-old woman in a common-law marriage. She completed primary education and is thankful to her parents for the support they have provided her. She has 2 children with her partner. As a family, they have been working in agriculture for a long time, planting vegetables and coffee. Her parents taught her how to farm, and she continues to farm today since this is her family's source of income.

Her crops are sold to intermediaries who come to the area, and who categorize her product as being hygienic and of high quality. 

The land that they cultivate is their own and they acquired it thanks to an inheritance given to them by Fatima's father. He gave it to them so that they could grow their crops and earn income for their family.

Today they are asking for help to buy fertilizers, manure and pesticides for their coffee crops and to maintain their vegetable crops. This will help to increase their earnings and to ensure that they get a good harvest.

Their future plans are to have a large coffee plantation, to generate more income in this way. This will help them to cover education costs for their children, their food, and other necessary expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure and pesticides for her coffee and vegetable crops.

loans.name: Mawusi

texts.en:
Mawusi is a 30-year-old hairdresser. She has been in this business for the past three years and is doing very well. She is married to Godwin, a 42-year-old driver. T

They have a child in the lower primary school. She joined ID Ghana in 2013 through another beneficiary of the credit scheme. She is a very dedicated and hardworking individual. 

She is applying for her first loan and needs GHS 400 to buy more creams/wigs to sell to her customers in the community in Dansoman.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Majed

texts.en: Majed is a 53-year-old married man and a father for four children. After his retirement from the military, Majed opened a food market to sell the families in the neighborhood the most wanted basic food items. Now he wants to expand by adding new types of food products like spices, rice, and sugar to have variety in what he sells. For that purpose, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: add new types of food products like spices, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela, de 37 años de edad , vive con Jorge y sus 4 hijos, en la casa de su madre desde hace algunos años.
Adela se dedica a  cultivar de papa, olluco y avena desde hace 12 años, mientras su esposo tiene un taller de carpintería donde fabrica los mejores muebles, en sus tiempos libres se dedica a cuidar a sus animales de granja. Sus labores son muy rentables por lo que viven cómodamente sin pasar apuro alguno, pero como tampoco sobra el dinero en casa, quiere comprar varias cabezas de ganado vacuno, sobretodo vacas, de las cuales pueda extraer la leche y elaborar quesos de diferentes tamaños para llevarlos a comercializar a diario en las tiendas de su localidad.Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se muestra contenta de recibir el apoyo financiero necesario para seguir adelante.Adela, invertirá los S/. 2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Adela, 37, has lived with Jorge and her four children in her mother's house for several years.

Adela has made a living for 12 years growing potatoes, olluco, and oats.  Her husband has a furniture shop where he makes the best furniture.  In her free time she takes care of her farm animals.

Her jobs are very profitable and they live comfortably without any hardship whatsoever.  They don't have any extra money at home either, though, so she wants to buy several head of cattle, especially cows to extract the milk and make different sizes of cheese to sell daily in the stores in her town.

This is her sixth loan with MFP and she's happy about receiving the financial support necessary to get ahead.

Adela will invest the 2000 soles [PEN] in buying organic soil amendments to nourish her fields.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments

loans.name: Erlin Maria

texts.es:
Erlin es una mujer luchadora, emprendedora y joven de 29 años de edad madre soltera de 2 hijos los cuales viven con y dependen de ella en todos los aspectos. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario completo y no pudo seguir estudiando por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron dicha actividad hace un tiempo y que hasta hoy en día es medio de ingreso para sus padres, para ella y sus hijos. Las diferentes actividades en sus cultivos son elaboradas por la familia ya que juntos son apoyo mutuo en la agricultura como unión familiar. Su producto es comercializado y vendido en el mercado local en pequeña escala con los diferentes vendedores de la zona. 

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de insumos que mejoraran sus cultivos de café y hortaliza ya que por medio de esto ella podrá asegurar sus cosechas y el producto.

Sus planes y metas a futuro son de ampliar sus cultivos comprando mas tierra en la que ella pueda trabajar ya que de ella dependen 2 pequeños y sus sueño es verlos realizados y estudiados a nivel universitario evitando que no pasen por lo mismo que ella paso en su juventud.
texts.en:
Erlin is a hardworking, entrepreneurial young woman of 29 years of age. She is a single mother of 2 children who live with her and depend entirely on her for support. She finished her primary education and then couldn't continue her studies because her parents were not able to support her financially. Her parents taught her how to work in agriculture, which continues to be the way she earns a living for herself, her parents and her children. The family works together on different agricultural activities as they support the family by farming. Their crops are marketed and sold in local markets on a small scale by the different vendors in the area.

Currently Erlin is asking for help to buy agricultural inputs, which will improve her coffee and vegetable crops. In this way she will be sure to have a good harvest and crops.

Her plans and goals for the future are to expand her crops by buying more land, since 2 little ones depend on her. Her dream is to see them go to university and avoid them going through the same things that she experienced in her youth.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to improve her coffee and vegetable crops.

loans.name: Las Joyitas Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LAS JOYITAS está  compuesto por diez  integrantes, todas mujeres,  El  presidenta del banco es la Sra. Silvia  tiene 37 años, casada tiene tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella  se dedica  a la venta de material de construcción como parquet para piso, ella tiene su tienda que se encuentra en la zona 16 de Julio,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Silvia  va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción ya que esto le permitirá surtir su tienda, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su trabajo, la Sra. Silvia  va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar diferentes lozas y parquet para seguir surtiendo su negocio, la Sra. Silvia  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada  en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es su única  actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Las Joyitas Communal Bank is made up of 10 members, all women.

The president of the bank is Silvia, 37.  She's married and has three school-age children.  She earns a living selling construction materials such as parquet for floors.  She has a store located in the 16 de Julio area.

This is Silvia's first loan sequence with the institution.  She's going to use it to buy construction material to stock her store.  She's requesting this loan to continue improving in her job.  Silvia's going to use the profits to buy tiles and parquet to continue stocking her business.

Silvia's a very hardworking person.  She's happy about the opportunity of being granted the loan because this is her only activity that allows her to support herself.

loans.use: to buy construction materials wholesale

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy, who is 33 years old and supporting two children, used her previous loan to stock more home products in her convenience store. She is now requesting another loan to buy basic food products such as rice, sugar and canned goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar and canned food for her store.

loans.name: Kefaa

texts.en:
In addition to looking after her home, Kefaa, a 47-year-old hardworking housewife, has an animal sales business that she operates with her husband. They have about 100 sheep and camels that are available for sale. They also sell the sheep’s milk.

Kefaa is now requesting a loan to increase the number of sheep and goats she has and enlarge the barn to hold more livestock.

loans.use: to increase the number of sheep and goats she has

loans.name: Fedwa

texts.en: Fedwa is a 56-year-old mother of three. One of her sons is now studying at the university, so Fedwa is applying for an education loan to pay his university fees to help him continue his studies and earn a degree.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s university fees

loans.name: Mayra Aracely

texts.es:
La clienta Mayra vive en Quevedo. La intención de ella de comenzar su negocio de venta de ropa fue con su esposo, poco a poco comenzó  por su barrio vendiéndoles a sus vecinos y despues llego a venderle al resto de personas por referidos.

No tiene dificultad en su negocio vende ropa de mujer y hombre, esta casada su esposo se dedica a servicio de taxi, tiene 2 hijos los cuales están en una escuela fiscal. 

Con el préstamo va a comprar blusas, edredones y pantalones. Su sueño es poder tener un boutique propio como las demás personas que venden ropa.
texts.en:
Mayra lives in Quevedo. She set out to start a clothing sales business with her husband. Little by little she started out selling it around her neighborhood to her neighbors, and managed to sell to other people who were referred to her. 

She has no difficulties in her business. She sells women's and men's clothing, is married and her husband drives a taxi. She has two children who are in public school.

With the loan she is going to buy blouses, quilts and pants. Like other people who sell clothing, her dream is to be able to have her own shop.

loans.use: To buy blouses, quilts, pants.

loans.name: Rosemond

texts.en:
Rosemond is a 33-year-old jewelry seller. She resides in the Dansoman community. She joined ID Ghana in 2009 and is still doing very well.

She has been in this business for the past nine years and is still doing very well. She is very good and discreet when it comes to her business. 

This is her ninth loan and she needs GHS 2,500 to expand her business and buy more goods to enable her to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more jewelry to sell to customers.

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.es:
Eulogio nació en la ciudad de Salvación y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú).
 
Eulogio tiene 60 años de edad y es casado entonces tiene dos hijos, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante y su actividad económica principal es la agricultura, él tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra plátanos, piña, yucas y maíz. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la agricultura y ve la muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmeras del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas, fertilizante y otras cosas. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Eulogio was born in the city of Salvación. He lives in the same city where he was born. (Salvación is located in the Manu district and province within the Madre de Dios department in Perú. 

Eulogio is 60 years old and married. He has two children. He is a hardworking and enterprising man who makes progress. His primary economic activity is farming. He has several plots where he plants bananas, pineapples, yucas, and corn. He has been involved with farming for several years. His business is going very well thanks to the determination he puts into his work. He belongs to the “Las Palmeras del Manu” communal bank. He is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other items.  He is grateful for and values the loan and commits to make his monthly installment payments.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers and other items.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 23-year-old single man. He is one of 11 siblings living all together in the same house. Mohammad goes to a governmental university and is majoring in historical studies. Now he is applying for an educational loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Neris Armando

texts.es: Neris de 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos, él es una persona muy humilde pero emprendedora quien trabaja muy arduamente día con día. Neris posee una parcela en la que se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijole, la cual posteriormente comercializa en diferentes departamentos del país, obteniendo muy buenas ganancias. él solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar pesticidas, abono y semillas de frijol y maíz de la mejor calidad para sembrar y así obtener una excelente cosecha para tener mejores ganancias y que le permita mejorar la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en: 43-year-old Neris lives with his wife and children. He's a very modest yet enterprising person who works very hard on a daily basis. Neris owns a plot of land where he grows corn and beans. Later on he sells his produce in different deparments of the country, obtaining very good profits. He requests a loan from INTEGRAL with which he can purchase pesticide, compost and corn and bean seeds of the highest possible quality for sowing. That way he'll obtain an excellent crop so that he can get better profits, which will allow him to improve his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, compost, etc.

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en: Eyad is a 20-year-old single man. He is the oldest brother of three siblings. Eyad works in a mall to at least cover his own expenses and save a little to pay for his education. Eyad is an industrial engineering student working hard to get his bachelor's degree. He is applying for an educational loan to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for his next semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Laura Angelica

texts.es:
La clienta Laura vive en Quevedo. Comenzó a ver la necesidad que preservaban  en aquellos tiempos sus hijos y ella empezó entregando comida a las personas que trabajaban en buses hasta que puso su propio negocio en la esquina de su casa de venta de comida, poco a poco fue incrementando su negocio. Tambien Laura tieneun negocio de venta de ropa para mejorar sus ingresos. 

No tiene ninguna dificultad, no es casada, si tiene hijos los cuales estudian en escuela fiscal. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar alimentos, carnes, vegetales, edredones y sabanas. Su sueño es tener un boutique propio o su restaurante para poder estabilizar a su familia.
texts.en:
Laura lives in Quevedo. She began to see the need in those times to support her children, and began delivering food to the people who work on buses, until she set up her own business in a corner of her home selling food. Little by little the business began growing. 

Laura also has a business selling clothing, in order to improve her income. She has no difficulty, she is not married and does have children who go to public school. 

With the loan she wants to buy food, meat, vegetables, quilts and sheets. Her dream is to have her own shop or restaurant so that she can stabilize her family.

loans.use: To buy food, meat, vegetables, quilts and sheets.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Doña Domitila es una mujer luchadora, emprendedora de 60 años y que a pesar de su edad ella no deja de soñar en grande. Tiene un grado de educación cursado hasta el 3 grado de la primaria y no pudo continuar ya que sus padres no pudieron apoyarla por la falta de dinero. Ella es casada y junto a su esposo y sus hijos se dedican a la siembra y cultivo de café, mismo que ha sido medio de ingreso para sus padres y hoy en día para su familia. Ella tiene mucha experiencia ya que desde muy pequeña fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra y junto a su familia por mas de 40 años. Sus clientes son intermediarios que llegan a la zona, vecinos, y demás que comercializan este producto como lo es el café. El terreno que ellos cultivan es propio y lo adquirieron con mucho esfuerzo y mucho trabajo ahorrando y restringiendoce de muchas cosas para poder tener donde cultivar y no alquilar.
